Reviews.Content: I have visited Amsterdam many times and stayed in most of the top rated hotel but the Amstel is by far the best...It is a classically designed and furnished with almost museum like attention to detail...Rooms are spacious and the hotel has good business and fitness facilities...For a Continental European Hotel and the service fom the staff and concierge team is excellent...The restaurant, La Rive, was very good and is supposedley the best in the city (I believe it) My one word of caution about the hotel is the fact that it is not centrally located...It is probably a 20 minute walk to the cental sights but, because of that, is a sea of tranquility in a very hectic city. When I go back to Amsterdam I will only stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fairy place in pieceful part of city”
Reviews.Author: KievDana
Reviews.Content: It was one of the best hotels, which I have seen. Huge wardrobe, great oldstylish disayn, nice decor and view to the river. Servis is exellent. Very tasty breakfest in room, amaizing bathroom. Only one problem - all rooms are non-smoking. Can reccomend for sweet weekend :-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDAMWFB
Reviews.Content: This is a world class hotel with amazing service. Perfect for the business traveler or a couple getting away for a few days. From the Michelin restaurant to the rooms all with sunflower shower heads - it's all the best. The staff are highly trained and provide impeccable service. (The only exception was the staff in the atrium where ordering a cocktail became a bit of a slow motion ordeal). There's a fine little gym but great running maps if you want a better work out. The rooms are wonderfully appointed with the best ones overlooking the canal away from the street. Lower numbers are more quiet. If you want to stay at a first class luxury hotel in Amsterdam, you won't go wrong if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: topsmed
Reviews.Content: One of the most pleasant features of this hotel is that there are few rooms compared with the amount of public space, so that the hotel mostly feels quiet and peaceful. The comprehensive national smoking ban in effect since 1 July 2008 has taken care of what used to be a huge discomfort for the non smoking guests. The rooms are spacious, decorated in a classic style (mix of French and Dutch) and very comfortable (example: complimentary loose-leaf teas and infusions + Illy coffee machine). The river view is unique. I did notice, like another recent reviewer, that there were many stains on the carpeting in the bedroom. The bathrooms are superb. The standards of housekeeping and the attention to detail are first rate and at the level of the top European palace hotels. The food in the Lounge and Brasserie has improved recently and the terrace on the river has been restyled. The spa area is not large but the fitness (new equipment), pool and sauna are very elegant and relaxing. The service in the Lounge, Brasserie and at La Rive for breakfast has become poor. Waiting time for dishes is far too long. Breakfast, rarely a strong point in Dutch hotels, has declined sharply (and is now poor value for money at 25 - 40 euro): no more delicious home-made jams, poorer quality breads, average pastries, more limited buffet selection, etc. This is particularly surprising, given the quality of Edwin Cats' cuisine at La Rive. The staff at breakfast was slow and confused, and I overheard several guests complain. The Amstel is still one of Europe's very good city hotels, but it should urgently sort out the service problems in the restaurants and it should serve a world-class breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with problems”
Reviews.Author: Pascal U
Reviews.Content: The good: The Amstel Hotel is a great hotel and is probably the best known hotel in the Netherlands. The building is beautiful and location is great if you are looking for a more quit area on the canals. Management has done a great job with the staff in recent years. These days staff is very friendly and attentive. Great, small gym, sauna and pool. The La Rive restaurant is one of the best in the Netherlands. The bad: The hotel is 140 years old and in most areas the maintenance is very good. However the room we stayed in (415) had multiple stains on the carpet as you can see on the pictures. Even though housekeeping keeps the room and bathroom very clean, this gave the room a dirty feel. Also, the outside of the building needs a new coat of paint yesterday. Do not book a room on the fourth floor as ceilings are lower, windows smaller and in our case only 1 window for the room. Checking 2 men in as Mr & Mrs is rude and ignorant. Keeping the Mr & Mrs even on the bill at check-out is just unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but bad location for seeing amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Bbi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is sensational (huge rooms, great service, great view) but in a terrible location if you're there to sightsee or otherwise enjoy the canal zone. Also no alternatives to the amazingly overpriced Intercontinental breakfast - more on that later. It's just too far away - can't walk, and you have to take two trams get back to the hotel from the center. When we tried to take the trams back to the hotel the second tram didn't come and we ended up walking a long wy. The hotel will call a taxi, but we had to wait 5-10 minutes for one to come. We moved to a more central hotel and enjoyed being able to drop in to the hotel when we needed a break, or to run out to shop or grab a bite to eat. About breakfast - we have stayed in several Intercontinental hotels in Europe and have been appalled by the outrageous high prices at breakfast. (Think 25-35 euros) Previously, the hotels have been near other breakfast places so it was no big deal. Once, in Rome, we got breakfast included as a promotion. The problem with this Intercontinental is that you have to walk a long way - at least a mile and a half to find a breakfast place. It's just too much of a hassle to stay here. We moved, to a small canal zone hotel, and by the way the price per night went from 500 Euros to 210, and although our rooms were smaller we were very happy there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel. concierge fantastic”
Reviews.Author: celbel
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. All the concierge are very helpful. Hotel is classy and expensive but worth it. I stayed 2 times in one month at this hotel and loved it more and more. The view from my room was breathtaking. Room service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Compliment to a fun city”
Reviews.Author: voyageur69
Reviews.Content: I check out of the Hotel Pulitzer and into the Amstel. And now I could breathe! A beautiful and clean hotel. The location is average. It is a taxi ride, a metro ride, or a 20 minute walk to anything nearby. But the rooms are spacious and large. The service from the staff was well above average. The concierge was helpful and knowledgeable and the front desk staff was one of the best I have every encountered. The only negative was the first night I ordered room service it took over 1 hour to arrive. However, the people were apologetic and explained they had a big party they were servicing that night. The breakfast is a bit weak also. Overall, this must be one of the best in Amsterdam. For the same price as the Hotel Pulitzer, the values do not compare!

Reviews.Title: “Just fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: blacklab
Reviews.Content: Simply the best! Whenever I have to spend time in Amsterdam, I stay at this fabulous hotel. Granted, it is not cheap but you get your money's worth, be it for the friendliness of the staff, the beauty of the dining rooms right next to the river or the sumptuous bedrooms. The only small complaint concerns the choice of programs on the TV - I find it very poor, especially for businessmen (neither CNBC nor Bloomberg). But this is a minor matter compared to all that is right at this hotel - one of my favourites in the whole world.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amstel”
Reviews.Author: Stuietoo
Reviews.Content: Visitors often have an advantage over the local residents, for they get to try some of the best hotels in any given area; locals tend not to stay in local hotels for obvious reasons; we live here. But last weekend my partner and I decided to stay at Amsterdamâ€™s Grande Dame Hotel â€“ the Amstel Hotel â€“ in which we have eaten and drunk many times over the years, for it is close to our Amsterdam apartment. Staying as a guest was just amazing; very sumptuous, great service â€“ almost regal but never stuffy! Luggage was whisked straight from our car to the room â€“ and we had a beautiful view of the River Amstel below â€“ while we supped champagne cocktails in the bar. Check in was very civilized and the receptionist accompanied us to our room, and explained the usual workings. The room was excellent; good strong Wi-Fi, the most sumptuous towels ever seen; wonderful rain shower we did not want to get out of; impressive lighting and a wonderful view. Also very quiet. We ate in the hotelâ€™s 1 Michelin star Restaurant La Rive, and it was delightful; the sommelier is excellent in our view and not only knows his wines, but he enthuses over them. His recommendations were spot on! The food was delicious, and it was good to see that the fish course came in small and large portions, so you could easily have a fish course (which we did!); only the soufflÃ© disappointed a little as it was more mousse than soufflÃ© we thought. Breakfast is choice of a buffet or full English â€“ though after dinner the previous night, we were hard pushed to eat very much. Complimentary newspapers were also available. Check-out was a very civilized 12.00 noon; plenty time to chill and pack to leave. The Amstel Hotel is well situated; trams are close by and the taxis arrive promptly, and the hotel just oozes ambiance and luxury. This was unlikely to be our last visit to our local favourite hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: calvados13
Reviews.Content: Having just spend a 4 day break at this hotel I can thoroughly recommend it. As an Intercontinental Ambassador I was upgraded to a beautifull corner suite overlooking the river. The rooms was spacious and luxurious and the bathroom a delight to my wife. As mentioned previously the 'rain' showers in the rooms are great. I had no problems with any of the staff and found them all to be helpful and courteous. I will definately be returning to this hotel at the earliest oppertunity.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Wereldreizigster
Reviews.Content: Lovely old hotel at a canal.. Rooms are classic and beautiful with the best rainshower in the world as far as I can tell..the bath fills in a short while which is also great.. The restaurant is nice as well as the bar downstairs with a lovely view of the canals.

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt one of the best in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mrfalafel
Reviews.Content: Just echoing the statements below: this hotel has old world charm, amazing service and every element of luxury one could hope for. The canal side location is used to great effect in the lounge, restaurant and bars. The semi-private lift to the suites is another great feature. The only drawback for me was the location. I prefer to be a bit closer into the more pedestrian areas. Yes the tram service is excellent and there are always taxis outside of the hotel but its not quite the same as walking out into the hustle and bustle of city life. All in all, this is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in but in the future, I would pick either the SAS Radisson or the American Hotel when choosing luxury accomodations in Amsterdam based on their more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: baburshah
Reviews.Content: The building is nice even if a bit outside of the action. The doorman is always at hand and friendly. Check-in -seated- is prompt and courteous. Most, not to say all, the staff members are nice and ready to help. The room, actually an Executive Suite, is nicely furnished as is the bathroom. The overall feel is really nice but it lacks modern amenities for an hotel of this class : MP3 docks, flat screens in all rooms, fresh flowers, welcome amenities like chocolates. At more than 5000 â‚¬ per night, one would expect this kind of extra luxury the Amstel never provides despite this stay being my third stay. Overall a good and reliable option at a cost.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nix123
Reviews.Content: I wanted a great hotel in Amsterdam with a pool for a leisure stay. The Amstel was the most fantastic place to stay; cost an arm and a leg but worth it if you can afford it. Great room, food, service, nothing at all to complain about. I was a little worried about the distance from the centre of Amsterdam but needn't have been - the trams are fast and frequent and even to walk isn't that bad. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good anymore.”
Reviews.Author: poederlee
Reviews.Content: Staff at this hotel are not so helpful and have a surly attitude. Rooms are outdated and the corridors smell. Should be closed and properly renovated. Bathrooms also are old and leaky.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: melvinthemole
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just stayed stayed three nights at the IC Amstel. What a wonderful hotel. We stayed at the hotel using Priority Club rewards Points, and ww were upgraded to an Executive Suite. Our room was fantastic - antique furnishings - our room had a wonderful sitting area including a small library- partioned off sleeping area and had separate bath, toilet and shower areas. The staff at the hotel were excellent and treated us as if we were royality. The hotel is situated on the Amstel. It is sited to the south east of the centre of the City. I would say it is about 35 minutes walk to central railway station. However there are some lovely canal walks from the hotel, and the main theatres and opera house are only a few minutes walk away. For example Cats was on at the theatre. Some of the main museums are nearby and if you dislike walking and don't want to take a taxi, one of the tram lines is very close to the hotel which we used to travel to Anne Franks House - cost 1.60 euros. There is also an underground station nearby which takes you directly to central Railway station (north) or to Amstredam arena (Home of Ajax) in the South. The hotel offers an airport collection service. The cost of this service is 101 Euros each way (75 Euros if a loyality club member) We took a taxi from the hotel to Keunkenhof Gardens - cost 75 Euros each way (make sure you agree a fixed rate). The hotel has a fantastic restaurant La Rive - yes it's expensive but we felt wour visit was worth the money - check reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: pcinbk
Reviews.Content: Best hotel in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “First impressions go a long way”
Reviews.Author: coachK666
Reviews.Content: On our way to Kenya, exhausted from our NYC red eye flight, my wife and I arrived in Amsterdam bleary eyed at the Intercontinental around 9am. We were cheerfully greeted and promptly seated at the check-in desk. We expected (reasonably) to leave our bags at the hotel and trudge around the city. To our surprise, our room was not only ready, but upgraded to a canal view room. The room was fabulous: well-decorated, impeccably maintained, and quite large. We were also impressed by the bathroom, which featured a large soaking tub. Secretly, I think we both would have preferred to lounge around our room than sightsee. A frequent busines traveler, my wife has accumulated a horde of hotel reward points. However, I think we would both agree paying for the Intercontinental exceeded staying for free at a Marriott/Hilton/Starwood property.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Opulence”
Reviews.Author: abcd12345
Reviews.Content: The Amstel Intercontinental is a perfect choice, especially if you want a 1st class hotel, with excellent customer service. We could not fault any part of our stay. The check-in service was excellent, the concierge was very helpful, the room service was prompt (although rather expensive), the rooms were very well appointed and the hotel location was very nice. We booked the hotel as members of the Intercontinental - Priority Club, therefore we recieved additional benifits including early check in (09:00), late check out (16:00), a room upgrade (to river view) and complimentary drinks on arrival. On arrival we thought the hotel was a bit out of town, however we soon realised that the hotel was only 5 minutes from the tram stop (tram no.4 to city centre) and it was a pleasant 15 walk from the hotel to all the bars, restauraunts and attractions. During our 3 days we visited the Anne Frank Museum, The Red Light District, Dam Square, Rembraant Square, Hard Rock Cafe and various shopping areas. We would recommend them all ! We found the people and city very charming.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning place!”
Reviews.Author: ACPACPACP
Reviews.Content: The Hotel looks from outside like a palace - this continues on the inside. The rooms are nicely decorated in dutch flavor, although they are not quite big - even the higher price rooms. The real highlight is the restaurant and the Spa on the lower level. They are on the same height as the Amstel River in front of the Hotel, so stunning views from the pool or from the breakfast are guaranteed. Only thing that didn't work out quite fine was the wireless Internet connection. Their server crashed 3 times in 3 days, but they took it off the bill without discussion.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Royal Palace”
Reviews.Author: ReadHere
Reviews.Content: What an incredible spectacular palace in the middle of an otherwise modest city. All advance arrangements via e-mail were promptly responded to, and were faithfully done. Upon arrival you are greeted as royalty, and it just keeps getting better. Every last detail is spectacular. Outstanding breakfast, bar, terrace, dining. Rooms, lobby, gym, pool are all out of this world. Rock star spotted at poolside (Iggy Pop). Staff at all levels treats you with the utmost courtesy and respect. No ripoffs or jacked up prices for tickets, reservations or taxis/limos. Complementary goodies galore upon arrival. It's on a quiet side of town, near a tram stop, easy walk to start shopping or dining. Fantastic and plentiful amenities by L'Occitane. Prices are appropriate for a 5-star hotel, and it's worth it here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: markhomer
Reviews.Content: Really loved this hotel, attentive professional staff, beautiful decor and wonderful canal views; even the tourists on the glass boats waved as they went passed (must have thought we were famous!?). Although it is about a 10 minute walk to the city centre it was lovely to stroll along the canals and see some of the 'real' amsterdam neighbourhoods rather than the at times loutish areas around the red light/ central station areas. Drinks in the bar a little expensive but this what you expect to pay in this quality of hotel. Would recommend this hotel wholeheartedly to any people looking for a special weekend in a special city.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: greg486
Reviews.Content: Based on the wonderful reviews of this hotel, I booked a four-night stay at this hotel on its web site. I asked for a non-smoking room. When I arrived, I was shown to a beautiful room that smelled strongly of smoke and backed onto the elevator shaft (I would thus have heard the elevator each time it moves) When I objected, I was told that nothing else was available and that requests for nonsmoking rooms were only a preference and couldn't be guaranteed. After waiting about 30 minutes, they found another room that smelled better but also backed onto the elevator shaft. When I asked about that, the young woman said "There's nothing else available" and walked away. The much-vaunted service vanished. Apparently, if you pay Intercontinental an Internet rate, you get worse than usual treatment and only a choice of the worst rooms in the hotel. If you choose an Internet rate on this hotel's web site, beware! You may only get the worst rooms in the hotel and be treated in a rather cool fashion for complaining.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Charming”
Reviews.Author: threetenors
Reviews.Content: If your budget can stand it you must spend a night or two at this beautiful hotel. The rooms are extremely well appointed with very large bathrooms. The attention to detail is fantastic. If this is for business or for pleasure make the most of the facilities available and indulge yourself in the history of the building for a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “this is my idea of a perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliansorl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice and plan to return very often. This place isn't for everyone but for those like myself -who come to amsterdam to visit the museums and aren't interested in the tourist centers or the red light district- then it is the perfect place being about a 20 minute walk (through a neighborhood where the contemporary art galleries are located) to the vangogh museum. I must STRESS that a large room with a river view is definitely a MUST! I actually had such a beautiful view that we could see the Rjiks museum and the amstel river from the bed! The bathrooms are really among my favorite with large tubs that fill in 2minutes with separate class showers featuring amazing showerheads and really great water pressure. The bathrooms compete with those of the ritz (another favorite), but dont have all the marble, it's amsterdam so it's a different kind of elegance. The fourth floor(top) seems the best with the largest rooms but the third was great too and actually had better views because you are just high-enough from the river. The pool and gym are too small but are beautiful and on a hot summer day are very busy. The riverside sun deck could definitely use many more lounge chairs and poolside service personel is lacking. Overall though this is an excellent boutique hotel that is just small enough to make you feel like you are staying at a private club or rich relative's mansion. The restaurant was fantastical and it has a view that matches the food. The tasting menu with wine was a bargain and very well executed. The staff are so pleasant and warm and really make the food seem special. Room service was really well done and I had no problem with anything other then the pool and river deck. It is a small personable hotel far from the maddening crowds but closer to the museums and zoo. If you are an art lover then I also highly recommend having the museum reserve a car to take you to the Kroller Moller.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get bettert than this!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerAnonymous
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveler and thoroughly investigate hotels and restaurants before I go. The only thing this property could improve is the breakfast buffet. It would be nice if the selection changed daily for those of us that stay for several days. I canâ€™t say I have ever been to a property where the service, comfort and ambiance were perfectâ€¦ until now. The Amstel is all that and more. Although it is expensive, it is worth every cent. If you want to be treated like royalty then this is one property you donâ€™t want to miss. The staff anticipated our every need from welcoming us upon our arrival to leaving us a warm departure note. The dinner experience at La Rive was impeccable. They should be rated 3 Michelin Stars. I would return in a heartbeat and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what all the fuss is about...”
Reviews.Author: jim3171
Reviews.Content: Can't really believe all the great reviews of this hotel. My main beef is with the parent company Inter Continental Hotels. I booked the hotel only the day before arrival and was told that the only room left was an Executive King with River View at â‚¬375 per night. We booked for 5 nights. It did seem expensive but judging from the reviews on this site I thought it would be worth it. Upon arrival we were put into a Square Facing room (not river) and told this was all that was available with no explanation or apology. With exception of the view the room was fine, although upon closer inspection the CD player was not working which was replaced the following day. Also, the speakers in the bathroom were only connected to the TV and not the CD player?!? Why they set it up in this manner is beyond me. This along with the fact the TV was at least 10 years old and the in house films were fed through on VHS (bad quality) and only 2 english channels is definitely not what I would expect from 'one of the best hotels' in the Netherlands. The minibar prices were a joke - â‚¬5.00 for a mars bar! The setting of the hotel is very grand but seeming very dated now, and the staff have the air about them that you should be grateful to be there. I have stayed in many fantastic hotels in the world - this may have been one once but certainly isn't now. The hotel is fairly close to the city centre although it is a walk of 15-20 mins. Upon checking out I was told that for 2 of the nights the rate had risen to â‚¬440.00 per night - I complained this was not what was quoted and they said that I should take it up with central reservations - again without any apology or sign of empathy for the customer. For the money it was very disappointing. I have complained to Inter Continental about the room rate change with no response so far...

Reviews.Title: “Perfection...”
Reviews.Author: Travel_realist
Reviews.Content: This hotel defines perfection. Service, facilities, rooms, location. Words can't describe it. Book now!

Reviews.Title: “Stellar”
Reviews.Author: Zhaunk
Reviews.Content: Again an exceptional stay... As an RA in IC Hotels schema we were upraded to an exec suite with full (free) bar. The staff, including a wonderful SAS vet on minibar replenishment detail, were attentive to a fault. The style, the ambience, and the comfort of this hotel are all five star. I'll be back. I love the city...

Reviews.Title: “Superb, Excellent, Luxurious...........”
Reviews.Author: goneroaming
Reviews.Content: There are just not enough words to describe this hotel. Room was Exec Suite on Second floor over looking the Square. As another review has said - Breakfast is a rip off - not worth the 32.50euros at all. Afternoon tea though is fantastic. If you are Royal Ambassador, the free mini bar is great. Excellent staff. The Bar next to the La Rive restaurant isn't as expensive as I expected for the class of hotel for drinks - though 95 euros for Hine, althought I had a free taste, was stretching it a bit. Bathroom was excellent, L'Occitain toiletries. One of the best baths I have ever been in - huge and very deep. Will be going back there in a couple of months - even if its only to empty the mini bar. And I also took fotos.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: HLS1974
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just 1 night in March whilst attending a conference held at the hotel and I had a wonderful time. I had a very spacious room overlooking the canal and even the shower had a window providing yet another view of the waterside. I could not fault the service or the food and the concierge was particularly helpful in his attempts to get me and a fellow conference attendee on the guest list for an exclusive private party at a nightclub. I will definately stay at the Amstel the next time I'm in Amsterdam.

HotelInfo.Name: InterContinental Amstel Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Professor Tulpplein 1, Amsterdam 1018 GX, The Netherlands
